intro: Tritoma gracilis, commonly known as the slender tritoma, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. Tritoma gracilis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or prairie habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
